hanzi-su-wiki:
件

Значения

Вышеупомянутый; случай, событие, дело; условие

Мнемоника

Случай торговой сделки при условиях оплаты рабами 亻 или быками 牛.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The leader of the cow tribe is too important to deal with small matters and trivial affairs.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture this hoity-toity cow leader who thinks he’s too good for small matters and affairs. See him acting all fancy like he’s better than everyone else. The cow even moos with a fake British accent. How pretentious.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: All of his affairs are taken care of by Ken (けん) the samurai, who he hired as his underling.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Ken the samurai scooping poop for the leader of the cows, because that's a matter of poop and state.

humanum_full_description_en:
From " people " to " ox ", the original meaning is division and separation. "Shuowen": "Divided. From the person to the cow. The cattle are big things, so they can be divided." "Wei Shu‧Lu Tong Zhuan": "If the name and level correspond, that is, in the regular script of Huang Su, with the number of ranks. This Cao Shang book is printed with a red seal."

" Piece " can be used as a quantifier to indicate the number of things. Liang Sengyou of the Southern Dynasties: "The upper one gets more than 30 pieces, the middle one gets 20 kinds, the lower one just counts things."

" Piece " can also refer to things that can be calculated in modern Chinese, such as "parts" and "manuscripts". The term "object" in the southern dialect also comes from this meaning.
humanum_short_description_en: From " people " to " ox ", the original meaning is division and separation.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，從「牛」，本義為分、分別。《說文》：「分也。从人从牛。牛大物，故可分。」 《魏書‧盧同傳》：「若名級相應者，即於黃素楷書大字，具件階級數，令本曹尚書以硃印印之。」

　　「件」可用作量詞，表示事物的件數。南朝梁僧祐〈略成實論記〉：「上者得三十餘件，中者得二十許種，下者數物而已。」

　　「件」在現代漢語中還可指可計算之事物，如「零件」、「稿件」等，南方方言中「物件」的說法亦來自此義。
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，從「牛」，本義為分、分別。

從「 人 」，從「 牛 」，本義為分、分別。《說文》：「分也。从人从牛。牛大物，故可分。」 《魏書‧盧同傳》：「若名級相應者，即於黃素楷書大字，具件階級數，令本曹尚書以硃印印之。」 「 件 」可用作量詞，表示事物的件數。南朝梁僧祐〈略成實論記〉：「上者得三十餘件，中者得二十許種，下者數物而已。」 「 件 」在現代漢語中還可指可計算之事物，如「零件」、「稿件」等，南方方言中「物件」的說法亦來自此義。
From " people" to " ox", the original meaning is division and separation. "Shuowen": "Divided. From the person to the cow. The cattle are big things, so they can be divided." "Wei Shu‧Lu Tong Zhuan": "If the name and level correspond, that is, in the regular script of Huang Su, with the number of ranks. This Cao Shang book is printed with a red seal." " Piece" can be used as a quantifier to indicate the number of things. Liang Sengyou of the Southern Dynasties: "The upper one gets more than 30 pieces, the middle one gets 20 kinds, the lower one just counts things." " Piece" can also refer to things that can be calculated in modern Chinese, such as "parts" and "manuscripts". The term "object" in the southern dialect also comes from this meaning.

件字的基本解释

件
jiàn
量词，用于个体事物：一件事。
指可以一一计算的事物：零件儿。案件。
不平常的大事情：事件。
文书证明之类：文件。来件。证件。

件字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiàn］
［《廣韻》其輦切，上獮，羣。］
(1)分；分列。
(2)指案卷、奏状、文书等文件。
(3)指物件。参见“件目”、“件物”、“件頭”、“原件”。
(4)量词。指事物的件数。

件字的英文翻译

◎ 件
piece

件字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　件； 康熙笔画：6； 页码：页94第18
【唐韻】其輦切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】巨展切，?乾上聲。【說文】分也。【六書故】物別也。又名件，條件。俗號物數曰若干件。　【說文】从牛，牛大，故可分。

件字的源字形

件字的起名意思

：指分解，分开。用作量词，表示可以论件的事物，如配件，也有文书、信函等的意思，如文件。

Basic explanation of words
Pieces
jiàn
Quantifier, used for individual things: one thing.
Refers to things that can be calculated one by one: parts. case.
Unusual big things: events.
Documentary proof and the like: documents. Incoming. Credentials.
Pieces
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiàn］
["Guangyun" has its round cut, upright, group. ]
(1) Points; separate columns.
(2) Refers to files, memorials, documents and other documents.
(3) Refers to objects. See "Item", "Item", "Item Head", "Original".
(4) Quantifiers. Refers to the number of things.

Radicals: ｲ, 牛  (leader, cow)
Meaning Mnemonic
The leader of the cow tribe is too important to deal with small matters and trivial affairs.
Picture this hoity-toity cow leader who thinks he’s too good for small matters and affairs. See him acting all fancy like he’s better than everyone else. The cow even moos with a fake British accent. How pretentious.
Reading Mnemonic
All of his affairs are taken care of by Ken (けん) the samurai, who he hired as his underling.
Picture Ken the samurai scooping poop for the leader of the cows, because that's a matter of poop and state.
